metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20425 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: In the Lustre file system before 2.12.3, the ptlrpc module has an out-of-bounds access and panic due to the lack of validation for specific fields of packets sent by a client. In the function lustre_msg_string, there is no validation of a certain length value derived from lustre_msg_buflen_v2.

notes.Note: sbeattie> lustre was removed from the upstream staging tree in 4.18 (be65f9ed267fd7d8b3146b7c4be9ecdd3e0aa3ed)

criterions.comment: linux-meta-raspi package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.0-1008.11+21.04.1').
linux-meta-riscv package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.0-10.12+21.04.1').
linux-raspi package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.0-1008.11+21.04.1').
linux-riscv package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.0-10.12+21.04.1').
